action->Motion Sense.description: Ein Teerschlick kann nahegelegene Bewegungen durch Vibrationen und Bewegung des Bodens spüren.

action->Sticky.name: Klebrig
action->Sticky.description:
Auslöser Der Teerschlick wird von einem Nahkampfangriff getroffen

Effekt Der Schlick versucht die ihn treffende Kreatur zu @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Ergreifen}. Der Schlick muss immer noch eine Aktion ausgeben, um den Griff aufrechtzuerhalten.

action->Viscous Sludge.name: Zähflüssiger Schleim
action->Viscous Sludge.description: Der Teerschlick kann bis zu acht Kreaturen gleichzeitig gegriffen haben. Dies hindert ihn nicht daran, mit den Scheingliedmaßen anzugreifen. Ein Teerschlick kann sich an Decken und anderen umgekehrten Oberflächen wie in Schwierigem Gelände bewegen.

action->Zombification.name: Zombifizierung
action->Zombification.description: Eine Kreatur, welche stirbt, während sie von einem Teerschlick verschlungen war, wird einer schrecklichen Transformation unterzogen und kriecht nach einer Woche als Teerzombie aus dem Schlick hervor.

Tar Pit.name: Tar Pit
Tar Pit.description: A 15-foot-wide patch of tar covered with dirt and leaves attempts to capture creatures that step onto it.
Tar Pit.disable: @Check[survival|dc:25|name:Reveal the Tar Pit|traits:environmental,hazard] (expert) to disturb the surface and reveal the tar pit
Tar Pit.reset: Though the hazard still captures anyone who touches it, the surface doesn't become hidden again until it settles, which takes 24 hours.
Tar Pit.routine: (1 action) On its initiative, the tar pit pulls down each creature within it, thick tar adhering to the creature's body. A creature that was submerged up to its waist becomes submerged up to its neck, and a creature that was submerged up to its neck is pulled under and must hold its breath to avoid suffocation. A creature in the tar pit can attempt a @Check[athletics|dc:33] check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.pprgrYQ1QnIDGZiy]{Climb} to either raise itself by one step (if it's submerged to its neck or full submerged) or to move 5 feet if it's submerged only up to its waist. On a critical failure, the creature is pulled down one step. Other creatures can Aid the creature, typically by using a rope or similar aid or by attempting to pull the creature out with their own @Check[athletics|dc:33] check, with the same results as if the creature attempted the check. In addition to the usual results, a character adjacent to the tar pit who critically fails while Aiding moves into the tar pit. A creature that Climbs out of the tar pit escapes the hazard and lands @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} in an adjacent space.

action->Capture.name: Capture
action->Capture.description:
Trigger A Huge or smaller creature walks onto the tar pit

Effect The triggering creature sinks into the tar pit up to its waist. The tar pit rolls initiative if it hasn't already.

action->Fling.name: Fling
action->Fling.description:
Requirements The tar zombie mammoth has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} by its trunk

Effect The tar zombie mammoth whips its prey violently into the air. It attempts an @Check[athletics|defense:fortitude] check against the grabbed or restrained creature's Fortitude DC. If the creature is restrained, the mammoth gains a +4 circumstance bonus to this check. On a success, the mammoth flings the creature up to 30 feet overhead and up to 30 feet away (the creature takes damage from the fall as normal, up to @Damage[15[bludgeoning]|options:fall-damage]{15} damage for a 30-foot fall). If the flung creature lands on another creature, the creature it lands on takes the same amount of bludgeoning damage (@Check[reflex|dc:28|basic] save).

action->Shambling Trample.name: Shambling Trample
action->Shambling Trample.description: As @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.UNah0bxXxkcZjxO3]{Trample}, but the tar zombie mammoth Strides up to its Speed instead of double its Speed.

Creatures that fail the save are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and gain fire weakness 5. Both conditions end after 3 rounds or when the tar is scrubbed off (which requires 3 Interact actions). The tar zombie can't Vomit Tar again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Vomit Tar]]{1d4 rounds}.

Throttled Blindheim.name: Throttled Blindheim
Throttled Blindheim.publicNotes:
Inhabitants of damp, subterranean caves, blindheims resemble stubby humanoids with oversized, frog-like heads and bulbous eyes. Their eyes emit a soft glow at all times, but a blindheim can draw back the heavy membrane that normally covers them to emit an intense light as bright as day. These simple creatures use their lights to draw in or disorient prey, mostly small animals like lizards, rodents, or fish. However, they might go after larger prey if trying to feed their young. When they encounter creatures their own size or larger they retreat, flashing their eyes to facilitate their escape if necessary. They often hunt in pairs or small packs. Using their lights to coordinate from a distance, they slowly close in on the creatures they hunt. One common hunting pattern involves one blindheim diving deep and using its light to chase fish to the surface, while another up above snatches them up and tosses them onto the land to eat later.

Blindheims make their nests in damp caverns, especially grottoes next to underground lakes or bogs. An ideal nest rests in a cozy cavern with plenty of fungus to eat, a few fish swimming in a lake, and the comforting drip of water from the ceiling. Blindheims prefer to lead quiet and serene lives, and even when first born they emit only the meekest of vocalizations. A blindheim is born shining, and its parents cuddle over it to dim the light so as to avoid attracting predators.

It's not just animals that endanger blindheims. Underground peoples find the creatures useful and attempt to capture them for specialized purposes. Duergars use them as "raid frogs," placing heavy hoods over blindheims' heads and revealing them suddenly during raids to blind their foes. They sometimes send the creatures along with their slaves that lack darkvision into the mines as a source of light. Drow use them for some of these same purposes, and some nobles have been known to treat the creatures as mere lanterns, having them hoisted to the ceilings of their halls. Neither duergars nor drow take good care of the captive creatures, so blindheims rarely last long in captivity.

action->Crushed Windpipes.name: Crushed Windpipes
action->Crushed Windpipes.description: The blindheim can't vocalize and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} until its neck injuries heal.

action->Spotlight.name: Spotlight
action->Spotlight.description:
Bright light shines from the blindheim's eyes in a @Template[emanation|distance:30] (also creating dim light to 60 feet). Each creature in the bright light when the blindheim uses this action, or who enters it while the light continues, must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:18] save. It is then temporarily immune for 1 hour. This light remains until the blindheim dims its eyes by using this action again.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Critical Failure The creature is Blinded for 1 hour.

Activate Cast a Spell; The activation takes 2 if the spell normally takes 1 to cast, or 3 if the spell normally take 2

Frequency Once per day, plus overcharge

Craft Requirements Supply a casting of a spell of the appropriate rank. The spell must have a casting time of 1 or 2, can't have a duration, and must have an area of burst (10 feet or more), cone, or line.

action->Clot.name: Clot
action->Clot.description:
Trigger Turkek takes persistent bleed damage

Effect Turkek's blood hardens, sealing her wounds. Turkek automatically passes her next flat check to recover from the triggering persistent bleed damage.

action->Sanguine Aura.name: Sanguine Aura
action->Sanguine Aura.description: 30 feet. Around Turkek, wounds heal slowly and blood flows faster. The flat check to stop persistent bleed damage is DC 16, rather than DC 15. In addition, each time a creature in the emanation takes persistent bleed damage, it takes @Damage[1d6[bleed]]{1d6 additional bleed} damage.

action->Blood Let.name: Blood Let
action->Blood Let.description:
Requirements Turkek's last action was a fang Strike that hit the target

Effect Turkek rips her fangs across one of the target's arteries or veins, dealing an additional @Damage[(1d6+5)[slashing]] damage.

action->Siphon Blood.name: Siphon Blood
action->Siphon Blood.description:
Requirements A creature within Turkek's sanguine aura is taking persistent bleed damage

Effect Turkek draws her enemy's blood into her own body to heal her wounds. She regains @Damage[7[healing]] Hit Points.

action->Guide's Warning.name: Guide's Warning
action->Guide's Warning.description:
When Vare is about to roll a Perception or Survival check to determine her initiative, she can alert her allies as a free action. Vare visually or audibly warns allies, granting them a +1 circumstance bonus to their initiative rolls. Depending on how Vare warns allies, this action has the auditory or visual trait.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.UiISDbCjK6AUDsll]{Effect: Guide's Warning}

action->Snare Crafting.name: Snare Crafting
action->Snare Crafting.description: Vare can use the Crafting skill to create the following snares: alarm snare, hampering snare, irritating thorn snare, marking snare, signaling snare, and smoke screen snare. Vare can create four snares each day without paying for the materials, using 3 Interact actions to set up each snare.

action->Guiding Words.name: Guiding Words
action->Guiding Words.description:
Vare points out a weakness of a creature within 30 feet. Vare and all allies that can hear or see her gain a +1 status bonus to attack and damage rolls against that creature until the beginning of Vare's next turn. Vare adds an extra 1d6 precision damage to her weapon and unarmed attacks that hit that creature for the duration.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.uqjx1bwYduHwwC7d]{Effect: Guiding Words}

spell->Produce Flame.name: Produce Flame
spell->Produce Flame.description:
A small ball of flame appears in the palm of your hand, and you lash out with it either in melee or at range. Make a spell attack roll against your target's AC. This is normally a ranged attack, but you can also make a melee attack against a creature in your unarmed reach.

On a success, you deal 2d4 fire damage. On a critical success, the target takes double damage and @Damage[(@item.level)d4[persistent,fire]] damage.

Heightened (+1) Increase the damage by 1d4 and the persistent damage on a critical hit by 1d4.

action->Freezing Blood.name: Freezing Blood
action->Freezing Blood.description:
Trigger An adjacent creature deals piercing or slashing damage to Venexus

Effect Venexus's blood splatters onto the triggering creature, dealing @Damage[2d6[cold]] damage. A creature that takes cold damage in this way is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round.

action->Mist Shroud.name: Mist Shroud
action->Mist Shroud.description: 10 feet. The Primordial Flame continually heats the cold emanating from Venexus's body, surrounding the dragon in a thin veil of fog. Creatures in the aura are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}, and other creatures are concealed to creatures in the area. Venexus's storm vision allows her to see through this concealment, however. If wind disperses the aura, it returns automatically at the start of Venexus's turn. The aura is suppressed in water.

action->Storm Vision.name: Storm Vision
action->Storm Vision.description: Inclement weather doesn't impair Venexus's vision; she ignores concealment from fog, mist, rain, and snowfall.

action->Breath Weapon.name: Breath Weapon
action->Breath Weapon.description: Venexus breathes a cloud of frost that deals @Damage[10d6[cold]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[cone|distance:40] (@Check[reflex|dc:28|basic|options:area-effect]). She can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Draconic Frenzy.name: Draconic Frenzy
action->Draconic Frenzy.description: Venexus makes two claw Strikes and one tail Strike in any order.

action->Draconic Momentum.name: Draconic Momentum
action->Draconic Momentum.description: When Venexus scores a critical hit with a Strike, she recharges her Breath Weapon.

action->Ice Climb 30 feet.name: Ice Climb 30 feet
action->Ice Climb 30 feet.description: Venexus can climb on ice as though she had the listed climb Speed. She ignores difficult terrain and greater difficult terrain from ice and snow and doesn't risk falling when crossing ice.

action->Shape Ice.name: Shape Ice
action->Shape Ice.description: Venexus magically reshapes a cube of ice or snow she touches, up to 10 feet across. Any creature standing atop the ice must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:15] save or Acrobatics check. On a failure, the creature falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} on the ice; on a critical failure, it falls off the ice entirely and is also prone.

action->Snuff.name: Snuff
action->Snuff.description: Venexus releases a wave of sleet, which douses open flames within 30 feet. All non-magical fire is automatically extinguished. All creatures in the area suffering from persistent fire damage immediately attempt a @Check[flat|dc:10] to end the persistent damage. If Snuff overlaps with an ongoing fire effect, Snuff attempts to counteract the fire effect.

action->Tail Lash.name: Tail Lash
action->Tail Lash.description:
Trigger A creature within reach of the chosen's tail Strike uses an action to Strike or attempt a skill check

Effect Venexus's chosen attempts to Strike the triggering creature with their tail. If it hits, the creature takes a -2 circumstance penalty to the triggering roll.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.QqC9xymSXSVunDgl]{Effect: Tail Lash}

action->Change Shape.name: Change Shape
action->Change Shape.description: Venexus's chosen changes between their humanoid shape and hybrid shape. They gain a tail unarmed Strike while in their hybrid shape.

action->Flurry of Blows.name: Flurry of Blows
action->Flurry of Blows.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect Venexus's chosen makes two unarmed Strikes. If both hit the same creature, combine their damage for the purpose of resistances and weaknesses.

action->Ice Walk.name: Ice Walk
action->Ice Walk.description: Venexus's chosen ignores difficult terrain and greater difficult terrain from ice and snow and doesn't risk falling when crossing ice.

action->Powerful Fists.name: Powerful Fists
action->Powerful Fists.description: Venexus's chosen's fist Strikes are treated as cold iron and silver, and the chosen doesn't take penalties when making lethal attacks.

action->Snow Vision.name: Snow Vision
action->Snow Vision.description: Snow doesn't impair a white dragon's vision; the wyrmling ignores concealment from snowfall.

action->Breath Weapon.name: Breath Weapon
action->Breath Weapon.description: The wyrmling breathes a cloud of frost that deals @Damage[6d6[cold]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[cone|distance:30] (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic|options:area-effect]). They can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Draconic Frenzy.name: Draconic Frenzy
action->Draconic Frenzy.description: The wyrmling makes two claw Strikes and one tail Strike in any order.

action->Draconic Momentum.name: Draconic Momentum
action->Draconic Momentum.description: When the wyrmling scores a critical hit with a Strike, they recharge their Breath Weapon.

action->Ice Climb.name: Ice Climb
action->Ice Climb.description: A white dragon can climb on ice as though they had the listed climb Speed. They ignore difficult terrain and greater difficult terrain from ice and snow and don't risk falling when crossing ice.

action->Aura of Discarded Things.name: Aura of Discarded Things
action->Aura of Discarded Things.description: 30 feet. Items in the emanation can't regain Hit Points unless the effect that attempts to repair them counteracts the aura, which has a counteract rank of 5 and a counteract DC of 30.

action->Debris Shield.name: Debris Shield
action->Debris Shield.description:
Trigger The weykoward is targeted by an attack from an attacker it can see

Effect The weykoward intercepts the attack with junk, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to its AC against the triggering attack. If the attack misses and the attacker is within the weykoward's reach, it can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shove} the attacker. It doesn't need a hand free to Shove.

action->Wasting Gaze.name: Wasting Gaze
action->Wasting Gaze.description:
The weykoward glances at an item of 4 Bulk or less it can see within 30 feet. A creature holding or wearing the object must attempt a @Check[will|dc:26] save. An unattended item always critically fails this save.

Critical Success The targeted item is unaffected. All of the creature's equipment is immune to Wasting Gaze for 24 hours.

Success The item is unaffected.

Failure The item loses [[/r {10d6}]] Hit Points; this can make the item broken, but it can't reduce the target's Hit Points beyond its Broken Threshold.

Critical Failure The target item loses [[/r {20d6}]] Hit Points. This can't reduce the item below 1 Hit Point.

action->Cold Tolerant.name: Cold Tolerant
action->Cold Tolerant.description: Yana treats environmental cold effects as if they were one step less extreme.

action->Evasion.name: Evasion
action->Evasion.description: When Yana rolls a success on a Reflex save, he gets a critical success instead.

action->Nimble Dodge.name: Nimble Dodge
action->Nimble Dodge.description:
Trigger Yana is targeted by a melee or ranged attack from an attacker he can see

Effect Yana gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

action->Change Shape.name: Change Shape
action->Change Shape.description: Yana can transform into an Ulfen human, Tiny fox, or hybrid kitsune form. Using Change Shape counts as creating a disguise for the Impersonate use of Deception. He can remain in any of his forms indefinitely.

condition->Slowed.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]

You have fewer actions. Slowed always includes a value. When you regain your actions at the start of your turn, reduce the number of actions you regain by your slowed value. Because slowed has its effect at the start of your turn, you don't immediately lose actions if you become slowed during your turn.

action->Slow.name: Slow
action->Slow.description: A zombie is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

action->Dual Tusks.name: Dual Tusks
action->Dual Tusks.description: The zombie mammoth makes two tusk Strikes, each against a different creature. This counts as one attack for the mammoth's multiple attack penalty, and the penalty doesn't increase until after both attacks.

action->Impaling Tusks.name: Impaling Tusks
action->Impaling Tusks.description: The zombie mammoth makes a tusk Strike against a creature it's grabbing with its trunk. If the attack hits, the creature is impaled upon one of the mammoth's tusks, freeing the trunk to make attacks. Each of the mammoth's tusks can hold two Medium or smaller creatures. A mammoth can attack with its tusks while creatures are impaled upon them.

action->Grabbing Trunk.name: Grabbing Trunk
action->Grabbing Trunk.description: A Medium or smaller creature hit by the zombie mammoth's trunk is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}. If the mammoth moves, it can bring the grabbed creature along with it.
